item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/14/google-reader-gone/#comment-4015">Steve Gallafent</a>.
Tiny Tiny RSS looks like a strong contender.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Steve Gallafent.

Tiny Tiny RSS looks like a strong contender.

item.title: By: Steve Gallafent
item.dc:creator: Steve Gallafent
item.description: I just started testing Tiny Tiny RSS. http://tt-rss.org/redmine/projects/tt-rss/wiki
item.content:encoded:
I just started testing Tiny Tiny RSS.
http://tt-rss.org/redmine/projects/tt-rss/wiki

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/14/google-reader-gone/#comment-4013">lauramoncur</a>.
I hadn't heard of Vienna before, probably because I've always looked at web based readers.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to lauramoncur.

I hadn’t heard of Vienna before, probably because I’ve always looked at web based readers.

item.title: By: lauramoncur
item.dc:creator: lauramoncur
item.description:
I blogged about it this morning as well.
http://www.gadgetspage.com/software/google-reader-retired.html
I am trying out Vienna: http://www.vienna-rss.org/
It's open source and not perfect, but it's not as bad as Newsfire, that can't even read my .xml export file. :(
item.content:encoded:
I blogged about it this morning as well.

http://www.gadgetspage.com/software/google-reader-retired.html

I am trying out Vienna: http://www.vienna-rss.org/

It’s open source and not perfect, but it’s not as bad as Newsfire, that can’t even read my .xml export file. üôÅ

item.title: By: Ryan Markel
item.dc:creator: Ryan Markel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/14/google-reader-gone/#comment-4011">Joseph Scott</a>.
If you find one, let me know. I have never run into one that does what I need it to do.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

If you find one, let me know. I have never run into one that does what I need it to do.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/14/google-reader-gone/#comment-4008">Ryan Markel</a>.
Thanks Ryan. I think if I were going to run my own personal reader I'd focus strongly on open source options.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ryan Markel.

Thanks Ryan. I think if I were going to run my own personal reader I’d focus strongly on open source options.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/14/google-reader-gone/#comment-4009">julien51</a>.
The WordPress.com Reader is one option, but isn't a good match for the way I used Google Reader.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

The WordPress.com Reader is one option, but isn’t a good match for the way I used Google Reader.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description:
Hey, We posted a list on our blog; http://blog.superfeedr.com/state-of-readers/ There are a couple really good ones. The Wordpress.com reader is good too. I'm sure you heard about it? :p
I just wish it was easier to subscribe, with https://www.subtome.com/ for example :)
item.content:encoded:
Hey,
We posted a list on our blog; http://blog.superfeedr.com/state-of-readers/
There are a couple really good ones.
The WordPress.com reader is good too. I’m sure you heard about it? :p

I just wish it was easier to subscribe, with https://www.subtome.com/ for example üôÇ

item.title: By: Ryan Markel
item.dc:creator: Ryan Markel
item.description: I may have <a href="http://ryanmarkel.com/2013/03/14/losing-google-reader/" rel="nofollow">blogged about this just this morning</a>, and my alternative is <a href="http://feedafever.com/" rel="nofollow">Fever</a>.
item.content:encoded: I may have blogged about this just this morning, and my alternative is Fever.
